file_content.text: General Stanel Thul is coordinating our efforts near House Alde. Speak to him if you'd like to take a further role in this conquest.
You have saved my house's dream of ruling our world... and taught me much about what that will mean. I will not forget.
We will not forget the role you played in helping us against Organa.
The Killesas just surrendered. My men are returning from the outposts to take them into custody.
The Killesas are speaking of you as people of honor.
When they saw the tunnel explode around their lord, every man among them laid down their arms.
I will tell Moff Sarek of your heroism immediately.
Take ten heads for every one traitor, and they will not rebel again.
You must show strength.
I have won your place for you fairly, in a way they understand.
They will respect you now.
An unnecessary luxury, but it did not cost us the battle. This time.
Him and everyone else.
I will make sure of that.
Can you hold your own now or do you still need me to hold your hand?
Are we done yet?
He has learned. I hope.
Yes, sir!
The Thuls need not fear any further rebellion in their ranks.
It would be a waste to retain a group of your importance any longer.
It would be a waste to keep one of our few Sith here any longer.
It would be a waste to pin down one of our best operatives here any longer.
If the Empire is to keep you on retainer, our money would better go toward using you elsewhere.
I will not waste your talents here any longer.
The Killesas are saying you are a woman of great honor.
The Killesas are acknowledging you as a man of honor.
The tunnel entrance is just below this room.
The programming signatures point to Lord Cedarik Killesa.
Lord Killesa's my vassal! He swore loyalty to me personally when we returned from exile.
Your vassals have too much freedom. Slavery works better.
Your loyalty system is flawed.
I find the best oath of loyalty is a man's firstborn son in shackles.
Do not trust so easily.
Bottom line, no one's going to serve you if it doesn't serve them.
Oaths aren't worth much.
The most loyal often bear the most watching.
You cannot trust to that.
How naive can you be?
Were the droids after something in particular?
What was the target?
The parameters indicate the probes were to join an assault team in a....
My lord, this program indicates an assault team massing in a tunnel between here and the Killesa estates. I don't find any such tunnel on the blueprints--
The siege tunnel! Blood of the queen, they're coming through the siege tunnel!
Those attacks were meant to draw your guards away from the palace.
The droids were a distraction.
The wretched traitor! That tunnel connects his lands directly to our estates.
Does this "siege tunnel" lead inside?
The castle is under attack?
Yes. It connects directly to the Killesa estates.
And I sent the guards to defend the outposts... that was his plan.
Siege tunnel?
There's an old tunnel between here and Cedarik's estate. It was the escape route in ancient times, in case of a siege.
No one's used it in centuries, but... the tunnel opens right under this room! What are we going to do?
Defeating a standing army goes for time and a half.
This'll cost you extra.
Yes, of course, whatever. This is my family's home!
I will hold back this army myself if I have to.
They will not win!
You have proven a better friend than I expected.
You know this place better than I do. What's the best defense?
Any ideas?
I'll kill them all!
I would not have guessed your bloodlust would come in so handy.
Moff Sarek gave us cartons of thermite explosives. They take time to set up, but they pack a punch.
If you take them into the siege tunnel, you could collapse it on Cedarik and his army. Seal the access, so they can't threaten us again.
You should have sealed it off the minute you went to war.
A little late now.
You have taught me the importance of taking action.
How do I get into this siege tunnel?
Where to?
Let's go.
I don't know what I'd do without you here.
There's an entrance to the tunnel nearby. The storeroom is in the same area.
I'll recall my troops to defend the surface, but there is no doubt the real battle will be below. Thank you.
I cannot thank you enough for your quick work.
I don't know what the Organas were after, but that attack was long in the planning.
It was a costly defeat for them.
Their plan failed.
They have deep pockets, but it won't be quick to rebuild such a force.
You can count on me.
Moff Sarek has done me a greater service than he knows.
Moff Sarek honored me by thinking I was worthy of the attention of a Sith.
Moff Sarek was wise to hire you. No one else on Alderaan acts with your swift brutality.
Moff Sarek has still not told me your position, but I owe you my secrets and my lands.
Moff Sarek honored me to offer me your aid.
It is foolishness to spread your troops so thin.
It should never have happened.
We have not had outright war on Alderaan for generations. Our tactics are... somewhat rusty.
Who's the source of these? What were they looking for? And quickly.
Try to find the base. I'll find out what Chrimar knows.
I suppose the Moff expects us to take on House Organa. They're one of our oldest noble houses and loyal to the Republic.
Until recently, they've been without an army, but they've got supporters all over the planet. Including here.
You'll never find them! They've got top-of-the-line cloaking, better than anything the Empire makes! No probes'll get through, no spy-sats, nothing!
Do you really want to find out what happens if you don't tell me where they are?
Where are they?
I don't know! Do you think we didn't anticipate this?
I don't know! Do you think we didn't anticipate this? We know what sort of monsters your Empire hires.
I don't know! Do you think we didn't anticipate this? We know what sort of monsters they breed in your Empire.
I don't know! Don't think we didn't guess what sort of monstrous tactics people like you use.
I don't know anything that you could torture out of me.
I'm smarter than a probe droid.
I'm not worried.
Idiot! [Shock him.]
Ahhh!
House Organa denied raising an army, claiming it's just "patriots defending their lands." But their attacks are too organized.
We'll never find every group--we need to get inside their planet-wide communications. And that means finding a base with a physical link to slice into.
They will learn the folly of resisting the Empire.
I will find them.
Alderaan is a free world! We will never submit!
I have some expertise at finding things people don't wish found.
I'll track down the base.
You're a bloodhound, a vicious dog of the Empire!
Whatever. I'm on the clock.
Sure. I'll find the base.
How can you destroy the culture of an entire world, and call it a mere day of work?
Silence! If you stand with the Organas, you betray a thousand years of loyalty!
Where should I start looking?
No Organa will leave your lands alive.
I'll destroy them.
That, um, that's very thorough, but not entirely the point.
The Organa guerillas have a base hidden in some cave or other natural camouflage.
There should be a master comlink there, guarded by their best soldiers. If you insert this computer spike, it'll give us a back door into all their communications.
Once we can hear them, there's nowhere on this world they'll be safe.
Then we'll hunt them down.
If we slice into their command center, we can avoid falling into any traps.
A wise strategy.
Base, soldiers, comm. Got it.
House Organa will not make another move without us knowing.
What is--? Who--? Chrimar? Is that Chrimar Noven? That's a free nobleman of Alderaan!
Unhand him! Who are you? What is this about?
If you are to join the Empire, you should take more care to recognize those in power.
I am a Sith.
M--my lord.
I work for the Empire. The Empire you swore to serve.
I outrank you.
That wasn't exactly the terms of our agreement as I understood....
Moff Sarek sent me to round up these traitors.
I'm working for the Empire.
I--yes, Moff Sarek had suggested using tactics like--
Keep them from rebelling and the Empire will not have to punish them.
Protect your people better.
I'm solving your problems.
I told Moff Sarek this was an internal problem--
All of Alderaan will be thrown into chains because of you!
If you cannot rule your own vassals, how will you rule a planet?
Silence him, Thul.
You heard that. Be silent if you wish any mercy.
Silence, slave. The sooner you see reason, the easier it'll be.
Be still. [Shock him.]
Ahhh!
I expressed to Moff Sarek that this sort of heavy-handedness might--
Might finally have the effect all your feeble negotiations have not?
I'm not certain that someone of your profession should make this sort of decision--
I make this decision.
I've said before that being too harsh might stir greater rebellion--though, of course, that's up to you.
I believe that's up to me.
You two work this out. I've got some credits to claim.
This is your problem.
What is the Empire offering? We can match it. Alderaan has wealth. We can--
You can submit to Imperial rule or find every man, woman and child wearing that collar.
The Empire asks only your obedience.
Submit and you'll be spared.
Alderaan has been free for as long as your Empire's existed.
I've explained to Moff Sarek before, perhaps you'd have more luck trying to lure ants with honey...
And I explained that honey is quickly eaten and turned to dung.
Sir!
Thul vassals will now think twice about rebelling.
I did as you asked.
Excellent. I am pleased with your work, very pleased.
This spineless toad will make a poor lord of Alderaan.
Your man is pathetic.
Yes, it will take work to shape him. I hope you will undertake this for me.
I'll leave you two alone.
Indulge me. I am inspired by the success of your last task.
Remain as my representatives in House Thul. Aid Jorad and his men in crushing all resistance to our rule.
I would like to offer a commission. Be my representative in House Thul. Aid Jorad and his men in crushing all resistance to the Empire.
I would like to make you the voice of the Empire in House Thul. Aid Jorad and his men in crushing resistance to our rule.
Obey them as you would me, and with the same penalty for defiance. Tell them what you need to secure your hold across Alderaan.
Y--yes, sir. Sirs.
Obey her as you would me, and with the same penalty for defiance. Tell her what must be done to secure Thul's hold on Alderaan.
Y--yes, sir. My lady.
Obey him as if he were me, and with the same penalty for defiance. Tell him what you need, and he will ensure Thul's hold on Alderaan.
Y--yes, sir. Sir.
"Penalty for defiance." I like the sound of that.
So you're working for me now.
Let's start planning.
I will do my best to make this easy on you.
This must be difficult.
I... thank you for that.
House Thul is a great friend to the Empire.
